bioghist.p: The Program Evaluation Committee (PEC) was formed in the fall of 1985 by Villanova University President John M. Driscoll, with the appointment of twelve faculty members and two administrators. Father Dricoll gave the Program Evaluation Committee the charge to evaluate all existing academic and non-academic programs and to make resource allocation recommendations for each program. The Program Evaluation Committee report to the president was issued March 1988.

scopecontent.p: The Program Evaluation Committee records consist mainly of reports. Included in the collection are reports from various task forces including Environmental Opportunities and Constraints, Internal Strengths and Weaknesses, and Personal Values, and internal self studies and departmental reports. Also included are individual responses from members of the university community and departmental responses. The Program Evaluation Committee report submitted to the university president in March 1988 is also included in this series. The PEC report includes a complete set of minutes of the Committee (1986-1988).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
